commit_message:
Move all the deprecated server actions together into the bottom of doc

There are a lot of deprecated server actions API spread in mutiple places
of api-ref. This patch moves them together.

Partial implement blueprint api-ref-in-rst-ocata

Change-Id: If031239eb975bb73e30fcd81a2daa159f899e354
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/38/458738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. -*- rst -*- Add (Associate) Fixed Ip (addFixedIp Action) (DEPRECATED) ========================================================== .. warning:: This API is deprecated and will fail with a 404 starting from microversion 2.43. This is replaced with using the networking API. .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Adds a fixed IP address to a server instance, which associates that address with the server. The fixed IP address is retrieved from the network that you specify in the request. Specify the ``addFixedIp`` action and the network ID in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - addFixedIp: addFixedIp - networkId: net_id_resp **Example Add (Associate) Fixed Ip (addFixedIp Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-multinic/multinic-add-fixed-ip-req.json :language: javascript Response -------- No response body is returned after a successful addFixedIp action. Remove (Disassociate) Fixed Ip (removeFixedIp Action) (DEPRECATED) =================================================================== .. warning:: This API is deprecated and will fail with a 404 starting from microversion 2.43. This is replaced with using the networking API. .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Removes, or disassociates, a fixed IP address from a server. Specify the ``removeFixedIp`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - removeFixedIp: removeFixedIp - address: ip_address **Example Remove (Disassociate) Fixed Ip (removeFixedIp Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-multinic/multinic-remove-fixed-ip-req.json :language: javascript Response -------- No response body is returned after a successful removeFixedIp action.

commit_message:
Adjust the order of server actions in api-ref

Group the related API together to make it more readable.

Partial implement blueprint api-ref-in-rst-ocata

Change-Id: I1417e32c8209e86ece763262754f7074e670735c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/98/461998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: You can associate a fixed or floating IP address with a server, or disassociate a fixed or floating IP address from a server. You can attach a volume to a server. Reboot Server (reboot Action) =============================Reboots a server. Specify the ``reboot`` action in the request body. - reboot: reboot - type: reboot_type **Example Reboot Server (reboot Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-reboot.jsonPause Server (pause Action) ===========================Pauses a server. Changes its status to ``PAUSED``. Specify the ``pause`` action in the request body.Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409), notImplemented(501) - pause: pause **Example Pause Server (pause Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-pause-server/pause-server.jsonLock Server (lock Action) ========================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Locks a server. Specify the ``lock`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - lock: lock **Example Lock Server (lock Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-lock-server/lock-server.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Unlock Server (unlock Action) ============================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Unlocks a locked server. Specify the ``unlock`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - unlock: unlock **Example Unlock Server (unlock Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-lock-server/unlock-server.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Resize Server (resize Action) ============================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Resizes a server. Specify the ``resize`` action in the request body. A successfully resized server shows a ``VERIFY_RESIZE`` status, ``RESIZED`` VM status, and ``finished`` migration status. If you set the ``resize_confirm_window`` option of the Compute service to an integer value, the Compute service automatically confirms the resize operation after the set interval in seconds. **Preconditions** You can only resize a server when its status is ``ACTIVE`` or ``SHUTOFF``. If the server is locked, you must have administrator privileges to resize the server. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - resize: resize - flavorRef: flavorRef_resize - OS-DCF:diskConfig: OS-DCF:diskConfig **Example Resize Server (Resize Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-resize.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Confirm Resized Server (confirmResize Action) ============================================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Confirms a pending resize action for a server. Specify the ``confirmResize`` action in the request body. After you make this request, you typically must keep polling the server status to determine whether the request succeeded. A successfully confirming resize operation shows a status of ``ACTIVE`` or ``SHUTOFF`` and a migration_status of ``confirmed``. You can also see the resized server in the compute node that OpenStack Compute manages. **Preconditions** You can only confirm the resized server where the status is ``VERIFY_RESIZED``, the vm_status is ``RESIZED``, and the migration_status is ``finished`` or ``confirming``. If the server is locked, you must have administrator privileges to confirm the server. **Troubleshooting** If the server status remains ``RESIZED``, the request failed. Ensure you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, investigate the compute back end or ask your cloud provider. Normal response codes: 204 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - confirmResize: confirmResize **Example Confirm Resized Server (confirmResize Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-confirm-resize.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Revert Resized Server (revertResize Action) =========================================== .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Cancels and reverts a pending resize action for a server. Specify the ``revertResize`` action in the request body. **Preconditions** You can only revert the resized server where the status is ``VERIFY_RESIZE`` and the OS-EXT-STS:vm_state is ``resized``. If the server is locked, you must have administrator privileges to revert the resizing. **Asynchronous Postconditions** After you make this request, you typically must keep polling the server status to determine whether the request succeeded. A reverting resize operation shows a status of ``REVERT_RESIZE`` and a task_state of ``resize_reverting``. If successful, the status will return to ``ACTIVE`` or ``SHUTOFF``. You can also see the reverted server in the compute node that OpenStack Compute manages. **Troubleshooting** If the server status remains ``VERIFY_RESIZE``, the request failed. Ensure you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, investigate the compute back end. The server is not reverted in the compute node that OpenStack Compute manages. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - revertResize: revertResize **Example Revert Resized Server (revertResize Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-revert-resize.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Rebuild Server (rebuild Action) =============================== .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Rebuilds a server. Specify the ``rebuild`` action in the request body. To rebuild the server with preservation of the ephemeral partition, set the ``preserve_ephemeral`` parameter to ``true``. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400),unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - rebuild: rebuild - imageRef: imageRef - name: server_name_optional - adminPass: adminPass_request - metadata: metadata - personality: personality - preserve_ephemeral: preserve_ephemeral **Example Rebuild Server (rebuild Action)** Preserving the ephemeral disk .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-rebuild-preserve-ephemeral.json :language: javascript Response -------- **Example Rebuild Server (rebuild Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-rebuild-resp.json :language: javascript Rescue Server (rescue Action) ============================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Puts a server in rescue mode and changes its status to ``RESCUE``. Specify the ``rescue`` action in the request body. If you specify the ``rescue_image_ref`` extended attribute, the image is used to rescue the instance. If you omit an image reference, the base image reference is used by default. **Asynchronous Postconditions** After you successfully rescue a server and make a ``GET /servers/‚Äã{server_id}‚Äã`` request, its status changes to ``RESCUE``. Normal response codes: 200 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409), notImplemented(501) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - rescue: rescue - adminPass: adminPass_rescue_request - rescue_image_ref: rescue_image_ref **Example Rescue server** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-rescue/server-rescue-req.json :language: javascript Response -------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - adminPass: adminPass_response **Example Extended rescue server** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-rescue/server-rescue.json :language: javascript ``GET /servers/‚Äã{server_id}‚Äã`` Suspend Server (suspend Action) =============================== .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Suspends a server and changes its status to ``SUSPENDED``. Specify the ``suspend`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - suspend: suspend **Example Suspend Server (suspend Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-suspend-server/server-suspend.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Resume Suspended Server (resume Action) ======================================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Resumes a suspended server and changes its status to ``ACTIVE``. Specify the ``resume`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - resume: resume **Example Resume Suspended Server (Resume Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-suspend-server/server-resume.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Change Administrative Password (changePassword Action) ====================================================== .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Changes the administrative password for a server. Specify the ``changePassword`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409), notImplemented(501) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - changePassword: changePassword - adminPass: adminPass_change_password **Example Change Administrative Password (changePassword Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-admin-password/admin-password-change-password.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Create Image (createImage Action) ================================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Creates an image from a server. Specify the ``createImage`` action in the request body. After you make this request, you typically must keep polling the status of the created image to determine whether the request succeeded. If the operation succeeds, the created image has a status of ``active`` and the server status returns to the original status. You can also see the new image in the image back end that OpenStack Image service manages. .. note:: Starting from version 2.39 the image quota enforcement with Nova `metadata` is removed and quota checks should be performed using Glance API directly. **Preconditions** The server must exist. You can only create a new image from the server when its status is ``ACTIVE``, ``SHUTOFF``, ``PAUSED``, or ``SUSPENDED``. The connection to the Image service is valid. **Troubleshooting** If the image status remains uploading or shows another error status, the request failed. Ensure you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, investigate the image back end. If the server status does not go back to an original server's status, the request failed. Ensure you meet the preconditions, or check if there is another operation that causes race conditions for the server, then run the request again. If the request fails again, investigate the compute back end or ask your cloud provider. If the request fails due to an error on OpenStack Compute service, the image is purged from the image store that OpenStack Image service manages. Ensure you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, investigate OpenStack Compute service or ask your cloud provider. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - createImage: createImage - name: image_name - metadata: image_metadata **Example Create Image (createImage Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-create-image.json :language: javascript Response -------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - Location: image_location - image_id: snapshot_id_resp_2_45 **Example Create Image (v2.45)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/v2.45/server-action-create-image-resp.json :language: javascript Create Server Back Up (createBackup Action) =========================================== .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Creates a back up of a server. .. note:: This API is not supported for volume-backed instances. Specify the ``createBackup`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. .. note:: Starting from version 2.39 the image quota enforcement with Nova `metadata` is removed and quota checks should be performed using Glance API directly. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - createBackup: createBackup - name: backup_name - backup_type: backup_type - rotation: backup_rotation - metadata: metadata **Example Create Server Back Up (createBackup Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-create-backup/create-backup-req.json :language: javascript Response -------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - Location: image_location - image_id: snapshot_id_resp_2_45 **Example Create Server Back Up (v2.45)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-create-backup/v2.45/create-backup-resp.json :language: javascript Add Security Group To A Server (addSecurityGroup Action) ======================================================== .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Adds a security group to a server. Specify the ``addSecurityGroup`` action in the request body. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - addSecurityGroup: addSecurityGroup - name: name **Example Add Security Group To A Server (addSecurityGroup Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-security-groups/security-group-add-post-req.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Remove Security Group From A Server (removeSecurityGroup Action) ================================================================ .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Removes a security group from a server. Specify the ``removeSecurityGroup`` action in the request body. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - removeSecurityGroup: removeSecurityGroup - name: name **Example Remove Security Group From A Server (removeSecurityGroup Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-security-groups/security-group-remove-post-req.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body.

Specify the ``removeSecurityGroup`` action in the request body. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - removeSecurityGroup: removeSecurityGroup - name: name **Example Remove Security Group From A Server (removeSecurityGroup Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-security-groups/security-group-remove-post-req.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Rescue Server (rescue Action) ============================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Puts a server in rescue mode and changes its status to ``RESCUE``. Specify the ``rescue`` action in the request body. If you specify the ``rescue_image_ref`` extended attribute, the image is used to rescue the instance. If you omit an image reference, the base image reference is used by default. **Asynchronous Postconditions** After you successfully rescue a server and make a ``GET /servers/​{server_id}​`` request, its status changes to ``RESCUE``. Normal response codes: 200 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409), notImplemented(501) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - rescue: rescue - adminPass: adminPass_rescue_request - rescue_image_ref: rescue_image_ref **Example Rescue server** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-rescue/server-rescue-req.json :language: javascript Response -------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - adminPass: adminPass_response **Example Extended rescue server** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-rescue/server-rescue.json :language: javascript Resize Server (resize Action) ============================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Resizes a server. Specify the ``resize`` action in the request body. A successfully resized server shows a ``VERIFY_RESIZE`` status, ``RESIZED`` VM status, and ``finished`` migration status. If you set the ``resize_confirm_window`` option of the Compute service to an integer value, the Compute service automatically confirms the resize operation after the set interval in seconds. **Preconditions** You can only resize a server when its status is ``ACTIVE`` or ``SHUTOFF``. If the server is locked, you must have administrator privileges to resize the server. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - resize: resize - flavorRef: flavorRef_resize - OS-DCF:diskConfig: OS-DCF:diskConfig **Example Resize Server (Resize Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-resize.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Resume Suspended Server (resume Action) ======================================= .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Resumes a suspended server and changes its status to ``ACTIVE``. Specify the ``resume`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - resume: resume **Example Resume Suspended Server (Resume Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-suspend-server/server-resume.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Revert Resized Server (revertResize Action) =========================================== .. rest_method:: POST /servers/{server_id}/action Cancels and reverts a pending resize action for a server. Specify the ``revertResize`` action in the request body. **Preconditions** You can only revert the resized server where the status is ``VERIFY_RESIZE`` and the OS-EXT-STS:vm_state is ``resized``. If the server is locked, you must have administrator privileges to revert the resizing. **Asynchronous Postconditions** After you make this request, you typically must keep polling the server status to determine whether the request succeeded. A reverting resize operation shows a status of ``REVERT_RESIZE`` and a task_state of ``resize_reverting``. If successful, the status will return to ``ACTIVE`` or ``SHUTOFF``. You can also see the reverted server in the compute node that OpenStack Compute manages. **Troubleshooting** If the server status remains ``VERIFY_RESIZE``, the request failed. Ensure you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, investigate the compute back end. The server is not reverted in the compute node that OpenStack Compute manages. Normal response codes: 202 Error response codes: badRequest(400), unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404), conflict(409) Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - server_id: server_id_path - revertResize: revertResize **Example Revert Resized Server (revertResize Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/servers/server-action-revert-resize.json :language: javascript Response -------- If successful, this method does not return content in the response body. Suspend Server (suspend Action) ===============================Suspends a server and changes its status to ``SUSPENDED``. Specify the ``suspend`` action in the request body. Policy defaults enable only users with the administrative role or the owner of the server to perform this operation. Cloud providers can change these permissions through the ``policy.json`` file. - suspend: suspend **Example Suspend Server (suspend Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-suspend-server/server-suspend.jsonUnlock Server (unlock Action) =============================Unlocks a locked server. Specify the ``unlock`` action in the request body.Error response codes: unauthorized(401), forbidden(403), itemNotFound(404) - unlock: unlock **Example Unlock Server (unlock Action)** .. literalinclude:: ../../doc/api_samples/os-lock-server/unlock-server.json``GET /servers/​{server_id}​``

The next change will have the scheduler posting allocations when it's called.
Given in case of a reschedule or a move operation, the allocation should have
been created by the previous scheduler call, we need to delete that allocation
so the next call to scheduler for asking a destination would provide the new
allocation.

To be clear, when allocating an instance by calling the Placement API, the
API resource verifies existing allocations for the instance UUID and removes it.
That said, we would still want to directly delete existing allocations in case
the scheduler would return a NoValidHosts exception, because if not, it would
still have the existing allocations for a reschedule.

TODO:
 - UTs
 - Discussion on the interface and where to hook up the placement call

Change-Id: I45c1d9feb98e294c4038a262b82f0e76f891b463
Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims
"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-05-11 16:52:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/4a984455291fbe9453815a9fa950600c5c56c685', 'message': "Delete existing allocations when retrying

Once the conductor will allocate an instance by calling the Placement API,
there will be cases when the instance won't fit within the destination and
consequently leading to a reschedule. In that case, in theory the conductor
will update the allocation by the next destination it finds but in case of
a NoValidHost, we need to make sure we delete the contract if the instance
finally never landed.

Move operations are quite different since the instance was originally
running. In the unpredictable event where the move operation would fail, then
the allocation should still be set on the original host as the instance is
somewhere in the no-ground state, so operators can either resurrect it or
delete it (which will trigger an allocation delete).

Change-Id: I45c1d9feb98e294c4038a262b82f0e76f891b463
Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

commit_message:
Delete existing allocations when retrying

Once the conductor will allocate an instance by calling the Placement API,
there will be cases when spawning some unexpected issues can happen and
consequently leading to a reschedule. In that case, the allocation is
still set so we would like to remove it when the compute is calling the
conductor method for rescheduling.
We could delete the allocation after the call to schedule if we get a
NoValidHosts exception, but we agree it would be better to remove the
existing non-valid allocation quickier before the scheduler is called.
The main reason behind that is because in case of concurrent instance
requests, then when Placement will provide Resource Providers to the
scheduler, some of them could not be given if some existing allocations
due to rescheduling instances are verified. Instead, we should make sure
that all the allocations being verified when the scheduler is calling
Placement are for instances not being rescheduled, hence why the
allocation deletion before calling the scheduler.

Move operations are quite different since the instance was originally
running. In the unpredictable event where the move operation would fail, then
the allocation should still be set on the original host as the instance is
somewhere in the no-ground state, so operators can either resurrect it or
delete it (which will trigger an allocation delete).

Change-Id: I45c1d9feb98e294c4038a262b82f0e76f891b463
Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

commit_message:
Lustre support

Add Lustre libvirt driver support.

Change-Id: I69038c0f30acfc329e1fb078bd2cb8cc1eedd88b
Closes-Bug: #1641792
Signed-off-by: Wang Shilong <wshilong@ddn.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/88/446288/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_concurrency import processutils from oslo_log import log as logging import six import nova.conf from nova.i18n import _LE, _LW from nova import utils from nova.virt.libvirt import utils as libvirt_utils from nova.virt.libvirt.volume import fs CONF = nova.conf.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class LibvirtLustreVolumeDriver(fs.LibvirtBaseFileSystemVolumeDriver): """Class implements libvirt part of volume driver for Lustre.""" def _get_mount_point_base(self): return CONF.libvirt.lustre_mount_point_base def get_config(self, connection_info, disk_info): """Returns xml for libvirt.""" conf = super(LibvirtLustreVolumeDriver, self).get_config(connection_info, disk_info) data = connection_info['data'] if 'lustre' in CONF.libvirt.qemu_allowed_storage_drivers: vol_name = data['export'].split('/')[1] source_host = data['export'].split('/')[0][:-1] conf.source_ports = ['24007'] conf.source_type = 'network' conf.source_protocol = 'lustre' conf.source_hosts = [source_host] conf.source_name = '%s/%s' % (vol_name, data['name']) else: conf.source_type = 'file' conf.source_path = connection_info['data']['device_path'] conf.driver_format = connection_info['data'].get('format', 'raw') return conf def connect_volume(self, connection_info, mount_device): if 'lustre' not in CONF.libvirt.qemu_allowed_storage_drivers: self._ensure_mounted(connection_info) connection_info['data']['device_path'] = \ self._get_device_path(connection_info) def disconnect_volume(self, connection_info, disk_dev): """Disconnect the volume.""" if 'lustre' in CONF.libvirt.qemu_allowed_storage_drivers: return mount_path = self._get_mount_path(connection_info) try: utils.execute('umount', mount_path, run_as_root=True) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: export = connection_info['data']['export'] if 'target is busy' in six.text_type(exc): LOG.debug("The GlusterFS share %s is still in use.", export) else: LOG.exception(_LE("Couldn't unmount the GlusterFS share %s"), export) def _ensure_mounted(self, connection_info): """@type connection_info: dict """ lustre_export = connection_info['data']['export'] mount_path = self._get_mount_path(connection_info) if not libvirt_utils.is_mounted(mount_path, lustre_export): options = connection_info['data'].get('options') self._mount_lustre(mount_path, lustre_export, options, ensure=True) return mount_path def _mount_lustre(self, mount_path, lustre_share, options=None, ensure=False): """Mount lustre export to mount path.""" utils.execute('mkdir', '-p', mount_path) lustre_cmd = ['mount', '-t', 'lustre'] if options is not None: lustre_cmd.extend(options.split(' ')) lustre_cmd.extend([lustre_share, mount_path]) try: utils.execute(*lustre_cmd, run_as_root=True) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: if ensure and 'already mounted' in six.text_type(exc): LOG.warning(_LW("%s is already mounted"), lustre_share) else: raise

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-26 09:09:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/503ecd6eaf5ecaea51d1d034ded85ca2334cb4d6', 'message': "Fix a context argument in _set_vm_state_and_notify

commit_message:
Fix a context argument in _set_vm_state_and_notify

In '_bury_in_cell0' method of ComputeTaskManager,
'_set_vm_state_and_notify' method is called.
A context in arguments of '_set_vm_state_and_notify' method
should be a context for cell0.

Change-Id: Id560377fc5fe046ea62f0e558a14c2e614339ee3
Closes-Bug: #1693721

commit_message:
Fix keypair quota error

After command "nova keypair add kp_xxx" or
"nova keypair-delete kp_xxx", the in_use keypair quota of user
was not changed.

To fix this problem, it should update in_use of keypair quota.

And that it should return 0 by "nova quota-show --detail" and
return actual in_use by "nova quota-show --detail --user user_id".

Change-Id: Iba39cff9fb9b473fd7ca19e1288404279bb8d2f3
Closes-Bug: #1644457

commit_message:
Forcing a configdrive in cfg should populate DB

If you force a config drive for all instances, then it should result
in the config_drive column for the instance being set to true in the
instances table. Also, this should only happen on first boot of an
instance, not for things like hard reboots.

This change means we can't just use 'force_config_drive' as short
hand in testing for virt drivers, so there's some related fallout
there.

While we're at it, change the 'configdrive.required_by' function to
return a Boolean. All calls to this function expected this kind of
result.

DocImpact: the force_config_drive flag is only used on first boot
of an instance. We should tell cloud admins about this.

Change-Id: I0acc52ea20de46525f272c826b798f26200b323c
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephen.finucane@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1303714
Closes-Bug: #1241806

commit_message:
WIP: Scheduler returning alternatives per destination

As we discussed during the Forum, the scheduler should be returning more hosts
than the current situation (only one) so in case a future allocation from the
scheduler is not accepted, it could be asking for the next one without needing
to call again the scheduler.

Also, in case of a reschedule, it wouldn't need to ask again the scheduler.
So this change will provide alternative hosts to the conductor (of course if
only the conductor asks for that) so it could use those alternatives in case
the allocation API post is not accepted, but it could also pass the allocations
to the compute so when it's rescheduling, it already gets those.

TODO : Rebasing on edleafe's change needs a bit more work.

Change-Id: I7d20773164b1cde8a3d822147b0e3035c34daf2e

commit_message:
libvirt: Improve get_disk_type_from_path

Currently libvirt.utils.get_disk_type_from_path does not return flat or
qcow2 disk types, which decreases area of its usage. Also it's situated
far from imagebackend which knows all about disks at first hand, which
makes the code to be less clear.

This patch removes this gaps.

Change-Id: I7f271bdbf908606d75f0f52ed313beb054aca0ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/42/411942/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_disk_type_from_path(path, disk_format): """Retrieve disk type (flat, qcow2, lvm, etc) for given path and format.""" elif disk_format == 'raw': return 'flat' elif disk_format == 'qcow2': if get_disk_backing_file(path, format='qcow2'): return 'qcow2' else: return 'flat'
deleted_lines: def get_disk_type_from_path(path): """Retrieve disk type (raw, qcow2, lvm, ploop) for given file."""

commit_message:
Ensure image metadata when unshelving BFV instance

When unshelving an instance that was booted from a volume,
 "shelved_image_id" is None. Therefore, when performing unshelve,
 the image metadata could not be retrieved and ImagePropertiesFilter
 scheduling will fail. This patch ensures image metadata is added
 for BFV instances by querying the system metadata to recreate the
 image metadata.

Change-Id: I35a9cdf854eac706d13057b95e06512f7bbce37d
Closes-Bug: #1537434
Co-Authored-By: Xiaowei Qian <xiaowei.qian@easystack.cn>
Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/347063/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: image_meta = image if not image_meta: image_meta = utils.get_image_from_system_metadata( sys_meta) context, image_meta, [instance])

commit_message:
Remove mox from tests/unit/conductor/tasks/test_live_migrate.py(4)

This patch replaces mox with mock partially in
tests/unit/conductor/tasks/test_live_migrate.py.
This patch focuses on tests of _find_destination() method.

Part of blueprint remove-mox-pike

commit_message:
libvirt: Skip file operations for not appropriate disk types

Handling get_instance_disk_info result data, libvirt driver invokes
various file operations for files, pointed by this data. This is used
for copying disks during cold migration, preparing empty image for block
live migration, etc. This cannot work with such disk types like lvm or
rbd, though, the driver works because of other direct and indirect
checks. However this prevents us to add new disk types.

This patch makes the driver to invoke the file operations if disk type
of a disk is supported by certain operation.

Change-Id: I866036fe6ff788f41cf02903415999f6593fec67

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix snapshot operation under LXC

Ic3a3c738 added a trivial error into snapshot method which might affect
LXC. This patch fixes the error. Additionaly fake_libvirt_utils is
changed to verify the fix. This has required some test changes.

Related-Bug: 1539179
Change-Id: I02efa6d63c684da3f5322f16964ebb0f84b4ef4d

commit_message:
libvirt: Attach and detach encryptors during swap_volume

Previously no attempt would be made to attach or detach encryptors from
either the new or old volume during swap_volume. This would in turn lead
to failures disconnecting the old volume and the new volume being left
attached to the instance unencrypted.

This change ensures that encryptors are attached to the new
volume prior to the swap commencing and detached from the old volume
prior to it being disconnected from the host. If an error is encountered
rebasing or pivoting to the new volume then the encryptor associated
with this volume is also detached prior to it being disconnected.

This includes providing the request context to swap_volume in order to
fetch the volume encryption metadata from Cinder. Ultimately we should
look at storing this within the BDM but for now we need to fetch this
for both volumes during the swap.

Closes-bug: #1685875
Change-Id: I0e2a3b105df2455aed9406389be6c5d0b65a4fd5

commit_message:
Pass the number of hosts to return explicitly

For better efficiency when retrying builds that fail, we would like to
return more than one acceptable host from the scheduler for each
requested instance. Rather than limit the scheduler to only return a
fixed number, based on a Nova-specific config option, allow the
scheduler to accept the number of hosts to return. The default is 1,
which will keep backwards-compatibility if nothing is specified.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

Change-Id: I4a3644f0add627eca998d8686fffbd4cbc5ffdc3

Adds man page for 'nova-manage db online_data_migrations' with details
about the available return codes.

Closes-Bug: #1670738

added_lines: ``nova-manage db online_data_migrations`` Performs data migrations to update all online data into a the new format. This command returns 0 if no migrations were scheduled. It returns 1 if there are currently scheduled migrations. The migrations will continue to run in the background after the command exits. This command should continue to be executed until it returns 0.

commit_message:
Return multiple hosts from select_destinations

With this patch, the scheduler will now return the requested number of
hosts in a list, with the first item in the list being the selected host
against which the requested resources have already been claimed,
followed by zero or more alternate hosts, all of whom meet the basic
requirements of the the request. In the event that there are fewer hosts
that meet the requested requirements, there can be fewer than the
requested number of alternates returned.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

Change-Id: I555ae8bda6d1b9de3837cd65662e1649685e75e0

deleted_lines: hosts = self._schedule_instances( for (instance, host) in six.moves.zip(instances, hosts): (host, node) = (host_state['host'], host_state['nodename'])

commit_message:
libvirt: a method to prepare SPICE console connection

A new method that sets a password on a SPICE graphical interface
and returns the port SPICE listens on

Partially implements blueprint spice-native-client-support
Change-Id: I95927bdffc124aedd1484323328196d74995654e

added_lines: def get_all_graphic_devices(self): """Returns all the graphic devices for a guest :returns: a list of LibvirtConfigGuestGraphics instances """ return self.get_all_devices(vconfig.LibvirtConfigGuestGraphics) def prepare_display_for_connection(self, ticket=None, seconds=60): """Finds the first graphic device and sets a pssword which will be valid for a given amount of seconds :param ticket: a SPICE password. :param seconds: a limit on the validity of the password in seconds :returns: a port on which a display is listening on. """ graphics = self.get_all_graphic_devices()[0] if not graphics: raise exception.DeviceNotFound(device='graphics') if graphics.type != 'spice': return if ticket: graphics.passwd = ticket if int(seconds) > 0: graphics.valid_to_sec = seconds self._domain.updateDeviceFlags(graphics.to_xml(), 0) return graphics.port

commit_message:
Add is_vz_container function

Use this function to determine container instance on Virtuozzo

Change-Id: I6a8e3c735a298e2a755bc8f5cc551c5c5b87794e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/445947/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: elif (is_vz_container(CONF.libvirt.virt_type, os_type)): def is_vz_container(virt_type, vm_mode): if virt_type == "parallels" and vm_mode == obj_fields.VMMode.EXE: return True return False

subject: Have scheduler claim resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-11 13:23:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fe1e77ca7ff018b1876df1b37925aa6341e06be2', 'message': 'WIP - have scheduler claim resources

When the scheduler picks a host, there is a chance that another process
may have also consumed some resources on that host, creating a race
condition, which will cause the subsequent build of the VM to fail. In
this patch, as soon as the scheduler picks a host, it will attempt to
claim the resources on that host by creating allocations for that
instance against that host. If that allocation fails, it will then
select another host from the filtered/weighed list, and try to allocate
against that host. Only if it fails with all hosts will NoValidHost be
returned.

Unit tests for this functionality will follow soon.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

Change-Id: I10884935f9f197e62686669b4ea69dc0aeaf3af2

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2017-05-17 23:51:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/934da8a04bf1f42f3724154819b130dd05354483', 'message': 'Have scheduler claim resources

When the scheduler picks a host, there is a chance that another process
may have also consumed some resources on that host, creating a race
condition, which will cause the subsequent build of the VM to fail. In
this patch, as soon as the scheduler picks a host, it will attempt to
claim the resources on that host by creating allocations for that
instance against that host. If that allocation fails, it will then
select another host from the filtered/weighed list, and try to allocate
against that host. Only if it fails with all hosts will NoValidHost be
returned.

This patch, and those following it in this series, are an alternative
that demonstrates that the scheduler can and should be making the claim,
not some other process that happens later on. Claiming as soon as
possible will eliminate the problem with the same resources being given
to two different requests. It also reduces code duplication in the
future when other services may also use the scheduler for selecting
resource providers, since the claims will be done consistently. By doing
the claims in the conductor (for Nova), all other services will also
have to implement claiming code. Since it is the scheduler that is doing
the selection, it should be the scheduler that does the claim.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

Change-Id: I10884935f9f197e62686669b4ea69dc0aeaf3af2

commit_message:
Have scheduler claim resources

When the scheduler picks a host, there is a chance that another process
may have also consumed some resources on that host, creating a race
condition, which will cause the subsequent build of the VM to fail. In
this patch, as soon as the scheduler picks a host, it will attempt to
claim the resources on that host by creating allocations for that
instance against that host. If that allocation fails, it will then
select another host from the filtered/weighed list, and try to allocate
against that host. Only if it fails with all hosts will NoValidHost be
returned.

Claiming as soon as possible will eliminate the problem with the same
resources being given to two different requests. It also reduces code
duplication in the future when other services may also use the scheduler
for selecting resource providers, since the claims will be done
consistently. By doing the claims in the conductor (for Nova), all other
services will also have to implement claiming code. Since it is the
scheduler that is doing the selection, it should be the scheduler that
does the claim.

Partially-Implements: blueprint placement-claims

Change-Id: I10884935f9f197e62686669b4ea69dc0aeaf3af2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/93/463993/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix for resize vm_state stopped rollback
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-15 14:08:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cedaff02d118277575b1e617c00af21217a4d259', 'message': 'Fix for resize vm_state stopped rollback

Whenever an instance was in vm_state stopped and was
resized the state would rollback to active after failed
resize instead of stopped. This patch adds code to check
if a resize was performed in the exception and goes to a
new function to check the previous power and vm_state to
properly rollback.

Change-Id: Ia064c2ecaf86e2da14d7966e304ff4dd6917970b
Closes-Bug: #1551703

commit_message:
Fix for resize vm_state stopped rollback

Whenever an instance was in vm_state stopped and was
resized the state would rollback to active after failed
resize instead of stopped. This patch adds the current
instance state to the list of variables passed to the
'_error_out_instance_on_exception' from the resize
operation so that the instance is properly updated.

Change-Id: Ia064c2ecaf86e2da14d7966e304ff4dd6917970b
Closes-Bug: #1551703

added_lines: vm_state = instance.vm_state quotas=quotas, instance_state=vm_state): def _resize_rollback(self, context, instance, instance_state=vm_states.ACTIVE): current_power_state = self._get_power_state(context, instance) if current_power_state == power_state.NOSTATE: instance_state = vm_states.ERROR self._instance_update(context, instance, vm_state=instance_state, task_state=None) elif (instance_state == vm_states.ACTIVE and current_power_state == power_state.SHUTDOWN): self._instance_update(context, instance, vm_state=instance_state, task_state=task_states.POWERING_ON) try: LOG.debug("Instance in transitional state %s at " "_resize_rollback performing start request", instance.task_state, instance=instance) self.start_instance(context, instance) except Exception: # we don't want that an exception blocks the init_host msg = _LE('Failed to start instance at _resize_rollback') LOG.exception(msg, instance=instance) elif (instance_state == vm_states.STOPPED and current_power_state == power_state.RUNNING): self._instance_update(context, instance, vm_state=instance_state, task_state=task_states.POWERING_OFF) self.stop_instance(context, instance, True) else: self._instance_update(context, instance, vm_state=instance_state, task_states=None) @contextlib.contextmanager if instance.task_state == task_states.RESIZE_MIGRATING: self._resize_rollback(context, instance, instance_state=instance_state) LOG.info(_LI("Setting instance back to " "state: %(state)s, after: %(error)s"), {'state': instance_state, 'error': error}, instance_uuid=instance_uuid) raise error.inner_exception else: LOG.info(_LI("Setting instance back to ACTIVE after: %s"), error, instance_uuid=instance_uuid) self._instance_update(context, instance, vm_state=vm_states.ACTIVE, task_state=None) raise error.inner_exception

commit_message:
Ensure the root device will be replaced in rebuild operation

In rebuild operation, the instance root disk should be replaced,
instance maybe boot from volume or boot from image, in the past,
only boot from image rebuild to a new image will be done as we
expected.

Brief as follows:
    1.image to new image is OK.
    2.image to volume(image defined), the root disk has no change.
    3.volume to image, the root disk has no change.
    4.volime to volume(image defined), the root disk has no change.

This commit is intended to solve the rebuild of the two boot
methods instance to ensure the rebuild operation will be done as
we expected.

Change-Id: Idfed323c966c4f43905f3d55a58148e326cab0fd
Closes-Bug: #1657718
Related-Bug: #1378689

added_lines: def _create_root_bdm_from_image(self, context, instance, image_meta, bdms): try: # From image get root_device mapping img_bdms = image_meta.properties.img_block_device_mapping func = objects.block_device.block_device_make_list_from_dicts img_root_bdm = func(context,img_bdms).root_bdm() # String to bool will return True, need to restore it if img_bdms[0]['delete_on_termination'] == 'False': img_root_bdm.delete_on_termination = False img_root_bdm.instance_uuid = instance.uuid img_root_bdm.create() bdms.insert(0, img_root_bdm) except (AttributeError, NotImplementedError): # If image have no block_device_mapping LOG.debug("Image have no Block_device_mapping") detach_block_devices(context, bdms, recreate) detach_block_devices(context, bdms, recreate) # Exclude the root device and recreate it after bdms = list(block_device.get_bdms_to_connect( bdms, exclude_root_mapping=True)) self._create_root_bdm_from_image(context, instance, image_meta, bdms) def detach_block_devices(context, bdms, recreate=False): root_bdm = block_device.get_root_bdm(bdms) for bdm in bdms: if recreate: if bdm.is_volume: self._detach_volume(context, bdm.volume_id, instance, destroy_bdm=False) else: if bdm is root_bdm and bdm.is_volume: # Set destroy, detach the root device in database self._detach_volume(context, bdm.volume_id, instance, destroy_bdm=True) if bdm is not root_bdm and bdm.is_volume: self._detach_volume(context, bdm.volume_id, instance, destroy_bdm=False)
deleted_lines: detach_block_devices(context, bdms) detach_block_devices(context, bdms) def detach_block_devices(context, bdms): for bdm in bdms: if bdm.is_volume: self._detach_volume(context, bdm.volume_id, instance, destroy_bdm=False)

commit_message:
console: Move proxies to 'console/proxy'

nova provides two types of console proxy: an XVP proxy, and a websocket
proxy. Clarify this by placing these in their own folder.

Change-Id: If79513fafcf9cabf52097690fd69a96c2a4d4055

commit_message:
[WIP] Implement virt driver set_host_enabled

Prior to this change, there were multiple implementations of
disabling the compute service spread across the compute manager
and several virt drivers. This change consolidates that code into
a shared location by implementing the base virt driver's
set_host_enabled method.

commit_message:
abort_live_migration remove redundant check

During abort_live_migration operation there are 2
checks of migration status, one on api layer and one on
compute side, second one requires rpc request to be done
and also to query the db. This check could be removed as additional
one doesn't guarantee that live_migration is not already completed,
also is very small window between api and compute side.
Target compute host is now taken from migration object rather
then instance.host field, which allows to guarantee that nova will not
pause already migrated instance.

Change-Id: Ifc55db7ee75c725be5cf211940552df8acc0f0c4

subject: Give names to volumes during block device mapping
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-15 10:37:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3e8d469ced1d73747bcb7d7f03eca9071db04d33', 'message': "Fix creation of volumes during block device mapping stage

Currently Nova fails to create a volume from bdm for image->volume and
snapshot->volume mappings. The reason is that now Cinder doesn't allow
an empty volume name for create operation. This is introduced by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182994/

This fix assigns a name for a volume in that cases.

Closes-Bug: #1485198
Related-Bug: #1224972
Change-Id: I77482ea91ce41d541ce3b5fef62574347aff1e34

commit_message:
Give names to volumes during block device mapping

Currently Nova does not name volumes when it creates them from bdm for
image->volume and snapshot->volume mappings. As a result the user does
not know where the volume came from.

This fix assigns names for volumes in that cases. A template for the
name is 'nova-bdm-<N>-for-<source-description>, where N is an index of
the auto-created volume within that block device mapping,
and source-description depends on the volume source type.

Closes-Bug: #1224972
Change-Id: I77482ea91ce41d541ce3b5fef62574347aff1e34

commit_message:
Log is misleading

Now openstack can only talk to vCenter directly.
We have abandon ESX mode. I think log should been updated.

Change-Id: Ifc1a974fefdb68f2e63c58acccff09761453be84

commit_message:
Log when conflicting image/flavor metadata found

This is the first step in handling conflicts between image metadata and
flavor extra specs.

Change-Id: I3cb60d90aa971f0b6eaeb2e282e2a9156e224a76
Implements: bp extra-specs-image-meta-conflicts

commit_message:
[WIP] Deactivate powervm compute until ready

If we are not able to connect to NovaLink or there is no available
Virtual I/O Server, the powervm driver cannot function properly.
This change indicates that by disabling the compute service as
necessary until these conditions are resolved on a subsequent run
of the update_available_resource periodic task.

Change-Id: I366d9421436a077e963ced303717840a25a800ae
Partially-Implements: blueprint powervm-nova-compute-driver

added_lines: from nova import objects self.adapter = None self._initialized = False self.image_api = image.API() _init_host(force=True) def _init_host(self, force=False): if force: self.adapter = None # Build an adapter if we don't already have one. if not self.adapter: try: self.adapter = pvm_apt.Adapter( pvm_apt.Session(), helpers=[log_hlp.log_helper, vio_hlp.vios_busy_retry_helper]) except pvm_exc.ConnectionError: LOG.warning('Unable to connect to NovaLink') self._set_host_enabled(False) return # Make sure at least one Virtual I/O Server is available. try: pvm_par.validate_vios_ready(self.adapter, max_wait_time=0) except pvm_exc.ViosNotAvailable: LOG.warning('No available Virtual I/O Server') self._set_host_enabled(False) return self._set_host_enabled(True) self._initialized = True def _set_host_enabled(self, enabled): """Sets the compute host's ability to accept new instances.""" ctx = context.get_admin_context() service = objects.Service.get_by_compute_host(ctx, CONF.host) service.disabled = not enabled service.disabled_reason = 'set by powervm driver' service.save() if service.disabled: LOG.warning("The compute service has been auto-disabled.") if not self._initialized: self._init_host() if not self._initialized: # We failed to initialize, so we can't continue yet LOG.warning('Cannot retrieve resource information until the host ' 'is fully initialized') return {}
deleted_lines: # Build the adapter. May need to attempt the connection multiple times # in case the PowerVM management API service is starting. # TODO(efried): Implement async compute service enable/disable like # I73a34eb6e0ca32d03e54d12a5e066b2ed4f19a61 self.adapter = pvm_apt.Adapter( pvm_apt.Session(conn_tries=60), helpers=[log_hlp.log_helper, vio_hlp.vios_busy_retry_helper]) # Make sure the Virtual I/O Server(s) are available. pvm_par.validate_vios_ready(self.adapter) self.image_api = image.API()

subject: Change soft delete resources to prevent DOS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-14 19:46:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/467e90987e6738862d099c4373a0ee3d6aeaa13e', 'message': "Bugfix: Changes to Instance Soft Delete

Right now enabling soft delete opens up a potential DOS on
compute hosts. This is because soft delete releases the
instance's resources until the '_reclaim_queued_deletes'
function runs. This could allow a user to exhaust all resources
before they have actually been released from the host.

This patch changes the functionality of soft-deletes to not
release the resources until the soft-deleted instances have been
reclaimed.

Change-Id: I6850e6ad0fa5d075815b21e6116d2cf3f7949071
Closes-Bug: 1501808

commit_message:
Change soft delete resources to prevent DOS

Right now enabling soft delete opens up a potential DOS on
compute hosts. This is because soft delete releases the
instance's resources until the '_reclaim_queued_deletes'
function runs. This could allow a user to exhaust all resources
before they have actually been released from the host.

This patch changes the functionality of soft-deletes to not
release the resources (quotas) of the deleted instance on the host
machine until the soft-deleted instances have been reclaimed.

Change-Id: I6850e6ad0fa5d075815b21e6116d2cf3f7949071
Closes-Bug: 1501808
SecurityImpact

commit_message:
Fix ChanceScheduler returning a wrong node

Given that ChanceScheduler is not returning the right node for a compute
service, it's not possible to use it for Ironic drivers, or with the
functional tests.

Change-Id: If742a73be5823e3a217bff951e67d6f0dc568e19
Closes-Bug: #1692521

commit_message:
Update instance group during live migration

The instance group policy is not being honored during live
migration due to the failure to update the instance group
object in the request spec passed to the live migration
task.

Note that the usual check for getting the instance group is to call
setup_instance_group() but given we agreed during the Newton midcycle
that verifying scheduler filters by the scheduler was a terrible idea,
we can directly lookup the InstanceGroup object and avoid to use a
scheduler library.

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@free.fr>

Change-Id: I1e71c4a27559b23b992f203592d7df030505f03e
Closes-Bug: #1600251

subject: Nova flavor-list swap should be 0 when no value is specified
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-07 10:49:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/277dd9c1e76df09d241e576ece2484cf4c8d223f', 'message': 'Nova flavor-list swap should be 0 when no value is specified

Nova flavor-list swap size is shown as blank when no value is
specified for swap while creating flavor. During creation of
flavor, if no value is specified for swap, the flavor is create
with zero as a default value. During listing of nova flavor,
the command shows blank for swap size.

This patch fixes this issue by replacing None swap value with
0. Bumped an API microversion to 2.49 to maintain backward
compatibility.

DocImpact:For micro-version 2.49 swap size will be displayed
as 0 instead of blank for flavor-list command.

commit_message:
Nova flavor-list swap should be 0 when no value is specified

Nova flavor-list swap size is shown as blank when no value is
specified for swap while creating flavor. During creation of
flavor, if no value is specified for swap, the flavor is create
with zero as a default value. During listing of nova flavor,
the command shows blank for swap size.

This patch fixes this issue by replacing None swap value with
0. Bumped an API microversion to 2.49 to maintain backward
compatibility.

DocImpact:For micro-version 2.49 swap size will be displayed
as 0 instead of blank for flavor-list command.

Change-Id: I296222268618de16c33dbc1b0fe03c633215e580
Closes-Bug: #1436683
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/471715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2.49 ---- In the previous version, the command ``nova flavor-list`` was returning list of flavors with swap size as blank if no value is specified. From this version of the API swap size will be 0 instead of blank.

commit_message:
Raise os-brick minimum to 1.15.2

New release contains fix needed for online volume extend
to work. Upper constraint raised to allow for the fixed
release, now raising the minimum to make sure deployments
do not use the broken version.

subject: Make divisible py3 compatible in pure driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 00:53:23.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/pure.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/571f9c2635fe64f5207b6e732e734b74038949db', 'message': "Make divisible py3 compatible in pure driver

the code:
import platform
print('Python', platform.python_version())
print('3 / 2 =', 3 / 2)
print('3 // 2 =', 3 // 2)
print('3 / 2.0 =', 3 / 2.0)
print('3 // 2.0 =', 3 // 2.0)

in py2
('Python', '2.7.10')
('3 / 2 =', 1)
('3 // 2 =', 1)
('3 / 2.0 =', 1.5)
('3 // 2.0 =', 1.0)

in py3 Python 3.4.3+
3 / 2 = 1.5
3 // 2 = 1
3 / 2.0 = 1.5
3 // 2.0 = 1.0
So it need to modify the code to adapt to this difference.

Change-Id: If7053041d67bd78a7c9b464f342b00326970644c
Closes-Bug: #1596140
"}]
commit_message:
Make divisible py3 compatible in pure driver

the code:
import platform
print('Python', platform.python_version())
print('3 / 2 =', 3 / 2)
print('3 // 2 =', 3 // 2)
print('3 / 2.0 =', 3 / 2.0)
print('3 // 2.0 =', 3 // 2.0)

in py2
('Python', '2.7.10')
('3 / 2 =', 1)
('3 // 2 =', 1)
('3 / 2.0 =', 1.5)
('3 // 2.0 =', 1.0)

in py3 Python 3.4.3+
3 / 2 = 1.5
3 // 2 = 1
3 / 2.0 = 1.5
3 // 2.0 = 1.0
So it need to modify the code to adapt to this difference.

Change-Id: If7053041d67bd78a7c9b464f342b00326970644c
Closes-Bug: #1596140
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/89/391689/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

doc: Add Zanata CLI information

Change-Id: I576a9e36e535a909dc0d663c76723d20722d9a7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/i18n refs/changes/20/489020/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _zanata-cli: Zanata CLI ---------- OpenStack uses Zanata as a translation platform. While most operations around the translation platform are automated, if you want to communicate with the translation platform manually, you can use `Zanata CLI <http://docs.zanata.org/en/release/client/>`__. User configuration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You need to create a configuration file in ``$HOME/.config/zanata.ini`` that contains user-specific configuration. For information on how to create a configuration file, see `Zanata CLI configuration <http://docs.zanata.org/en/release/client/configuration/#user-configuration>`__. Project configuration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ To communicate with the translation platform, you need to prepare a project configuration file named ``zanata.xml`` in the top directory of a project you are interested in. OpenStack projects does not contain ``zanata.xml`` in their git repositories, so you need to create it manually. The following is an example of ``zanata.xml``. In most cases, what you need to edit are **project** and **project-version**. .. code-block:: xml <config xmlns="http://zanata.org/namespace/config/"> <url>https://translate.openstack.org/</url> <project>horizon</project> <project-version>master</project-version> <project-type>gettext</project-type> <src-dir>.</src-dir> <trans-dir>.</trans-dir> <rules> <rule pattern="**/*.pot">{path}/{locale_with_underscore}/LC_MESSAGES/{filename}.po</rule> </rules> <excludes>.tox/**</excludes> </config> Pull translations from Zanata ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ To download translations from Zanata, run the following command after going into a project directory. You are usually interested in only a few of languages, so ``--locales`` option would be useful. For more options, see the output of ``zanata pull --help``. .. code-block:: console $ zanata-cli pull --locales ja,ko-KR,zh-CN

commit_message:
Increase timeout of mixmatch functional job

[0] introduces proxying for Neutron. Which means we're also
running the Neutron tempest tests now and the execution time of the
job has increased, causing timeouts.

This change increases the timeout to 130 minutes.

0. Ic5e694259544c2c6ffe717d560fc18391f64a1a0

Change-Id: I8f34c9708e8e96fff6846a2bba73f6d94980ea69

commit_message:
Add documentation on i18n tools

In the parent commit we suggest to sync the translator list with
Zanata rather than adding individual translator one by one.
It is better the document covers this, but there is no good place
to explain these tooling so far.
This commit adds a page on tools.

Change-Id: I238e5bdcfe89ed86d0e5e0ded13d6abe2f2fb484

subject: Fix order of arguments in assertIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 08:07:39.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/negative/test_negative_auto_test.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/8aa42948988ea146aad6b6ab6cb0cdf94bea261c', 'message': "Fix order of arguments in assertIs

Some tests used incorrect order assertIs(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is

assertIs(expected, observed, message='')
Assert that expected is observed.
Parameters:
  expected The expected value.
  observed The observed value.
  message An optional message describing the error.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: Ic49b58a3d49a9275cb430d67baa355fccf2cbda7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertIs

Some tests used incorrect order assertIs(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is

assertIs(expected, observed, message='')
Assert that expected is observed.
Parameters:
  expected The expected value.
  observed The observed value.
  message An optional message describing the error.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: Ic49b58a3d49a9275cb430d67baa355fccf2cbda7

commit_message:
Add the capsule DB method

Part of blueprint introduce-compose

Change-Id: I3908ae25ad54f69b29731c2bce0c1e3840887df3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/01/484601/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list_capsules(self, context, filters=None, limit=None, marker=None, sort_key=None, sort_dir=None): query = model_query(models.Capsule) # (kevinz): comment since this will induce the query return None. # will find why later # query = self._add_tenant_filters(context, query) query = self._add_capsules_filters(query, filters) return _paginate_query(models.Capsule, limit, marker, sort_key, sort_dir, query) def create_capsule(self, context, values): # ensure defaults are present for new capsules # here use the infra container uuid as the capsule uuid if not values.get('uuid'): values['uuid'] = uuidutils.generate_uuid() capsule = models.Capsule() capsule.update(values) try: capsule.save() except db_exc.DBDuplicateEntry: raise exception.CapsuleAlreadyExists(field='UUID', value=values['uuid']) return capsule def get_capsule_by_uuid(self, context, capsule_uuid): query = model_query(models.Capsule) query = self._add_tenant_filters(context, query) query = query.filter_by(uuid=capsule_uuid) try: return query.one() except NoResultFound: raise exception.CapsuleNotFound(capsule=capsule_uuid) def destroy_capsule(self, context, capsule_id): session = get_session() with session.begin(): query = model_query(models.Capsule, session=session) query = add_identity_filter(query, capsule_id) count = query.delete() if count != 1: raise exception.CapsuleNotFound(capsule_id) def update_capsule(self, context, capsule_id, values): if 'uuid' in values: msg = _("Cannot overwrite UUID for an existing Capsule.") raise exception.InvalidParameterValue(err=msg) return self._do_update_capsule_id(capsule_id, values) def _do_update_capsule_id(self, capsule_id, values): session = get_session() with session.begin(): query = model_query(models.Capsule, session=session) query = add_identity_filter(query, capsule_id) try: ref = query.with_lockmode('update').one() except NoResultFound: raise exception.CapsuleNotFound(capsule=capsule_id) ref.update(values) return ref def _add_capsules_filters(self, query, filters): if filters is None: filters = {} # filter_names = ['uuid', 'project_id', 'user_id', 'containers'] filter_names = ['uuid', 'project_id', 'user_id'] for name in filter_names: if name in filters: query = query.filter_by(**{name: filters[name]}) return query

commit_message:
Modification of statistic_aggregation method

In this patch feching resource_id by resource's original_id was added to
statistic_aggregation method.

Closes-Bug: #1707653 
Change-Id: I70b9346146f810e2236ccdb31de4c3fedf200568

Add upgrades guideline for operators

This patch set will add upgrades guideline for operators.

Change-Id: Ic61e4e11ec50c221038a007559bd67fe48a3ac65
Implements: blueprint heat-rolling-upgrades
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/53/475853/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. ========================== Rolling Upgrades Guideline ========================== This document outlines several steps and notes for operators to reference when upgrading their heat from previous versions of OpenStack. .. note:: This document is only tested in the case of upgrading between sequential releases. Plan to upgrade =============== * Read and ensure you understand the `release notes <https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/heat/>`_ for the next release. * Make a backup of your database. Prerequisites ============= * Multiple Heat nodes. * A load balancer or some other type of redirection device is being used in front of the Heat nodes in such a way that a node can be dropped out of rotation, that Heat node continues running the Heat services (heat-api or heat-engine) but is no longer having requests routed to it. Procedure ========= These following steps are the process to upgrade Heat with minimal downtime: 1. Install the code for the next version of Heat either in a virtual environment or a separate control plane node, including all the python dependencies. 2. Using the newly installed heat code, run the follow command to sync the database up to the most recent version. These schema change operations should have minimal or no effect on performance, and should not cause any operations to fail. .. code-block:: bash heat-manage db_sync 3. At this point, new columns and tables may exist in the database. These DB schema changes are done in a way that both the N and N+1 release can perform operations against the same schema. 4. Create a new rabbitmq vhost for the new release and change the transport_url configuration of new heat-engine in heat.conf file to be: ``transport_url = rabbit://<user>:<password>@<host>:5672/<new_vhost>`` for all upgrade services. 5. Stop heat-engine gracefully, Heat has supported graceful shutdown features. Then start new heat-engine with new code (and corresponding configuration). Remember to do Step 4, this would ensure that none of the existing engines and api services would communicate with the new engine. 6. An heat-api service is then upgraded and started with the new rabbitmq vhost. This would ensure the new api service is only communicating with the new engine. 7. The above process can be followed till all heat-api and heat-engine services are upgraded. .. note:: Make sure when all heat-api services has been upgraded before you started to upgrade the last heat-engine service. 8. Once all services are upgraded, double check the DB and services

Add documentation for split-stack
